demographics.name: David Lee
demographics.supportServices: Nutrition consult placed post-operatively and re-engaged for RT. Social work support offered for managing treatment course.
demographics.mobility: Ambulatory without assistance. ECOG Performance Status 0-1 (1 during adjuvant therapy).

diagnosis.pathologicStage: pT4 N0 M0, Stage IIB (AJCC 8th Edition)
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Patient presented with a several-month history of intermittent, crampy mid-abdominal pain and significant bloating, particularly after meals.
pathologyFindings: Surgical Pathology (Jejunal Resection, 06/01/2025): Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, 4.5 cm. Tumor perforates the visceral peritoneum (pT4). All surgical margins negative. 0 of 12 regional lymph nodes positive for malignancy (pN0). Lymphovascular invasion is present.
diagnosis.priorProcedures: Segmental resection of the jejunum with en bloc removal of regional lymph nodes performed on 06/01/2025.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: Long-standing history of Crohn's disease, managed with intermittent therapies. This is a known risk factor for small bowel adenocarcinoma.
diagnosis.baselineStatus: Patient has recovered well from surgery and completed 4 cycles of adjuvant chemotherapy. He reports mild residual fatigue and has ongoing dietary modifications related to his Crohn's disease. ECOG 1.

treatmentPlan.modality: Adjuvant Chemotherapy followed by Adjuvant External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: The PTV encompasses the post-operative surgical bed, including the anastomosis site (defined by surgical clips), and the draining mesenteric nodal basin.
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT) is used to deliver a conformal dose to the target in the mid-abdomen while minimizing dose to the kidneys, liver, stomach, and surrounding small bowel.
treatmentPlan.priorSystemicChemo: 4 cycles of adjuvant 5-FU/Leucovorin chemotherapy completed post-operatively.
medications: Ondansetron (Zofran) 8mg PO, taken 30 minutes prior to each radiation treatment for nausea prophylaxis.
Budesonide (for Crohn's disease), managed by gastroenterology.
therapistAlerts: This is an upper abdominal IMRT plan. Daily CBCT is critical due to organ motion.
Patient has a history of Crohn's disease, which may increase his sensitivity to radiation-induced GI toxicity (diarrhea, cramping). Assess symptoms daily.
Verify patient is NPO for 3 hours prior to treatment as per protocol.
Assess for nausea and fatigue daily. Encourage patient to stay hydrated and follow nutritional advice.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in a custom Vac-Lok bag with arms up on a wingboard to clear the lateral fields. Patient instructed to be NPO for 3 hours prior to simulation.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV and Oral Contrast were administered to help delineate the bowel, kidneys, and vascular structures.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT simulation for adjuvant abdominal radiation therapy. Patient compliant with NPO instructions. Oral contrast helps visualize the small bowel to be avoided. Surgical clips from the jejunal resection are clearly visible.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Thomas Wilson (12/22/2025)
dosimetry.constraints: Bilateral Kidney Mean < 15 Gy (achieved L: 14.5, R: 13.8 Gy); Liver Mean < 25 Gy (achieved 20.1 Gy); Small Bowel Max < 50 Gy (achieved 49.5 Gy); Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy (achieved 40 Gy).
dosimetry.planNotes: Adjuvant IMRT post-resection and chemotherapy for T4 small bowel adenocarcinoma. The IMRT plan allows for significant sparing of the kidneys and liver while covering the target volume.

igrtProtocol.alignment: Primary match to surgical clips in the jejunal bed. Secondary check to spine for rotational accuracy.

fractions.organTargetChecks: CBCT reviewed. Excellent match to surgical clips.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Reviewed supportive care instructions for nausea and diarrhea.
fractions.dailyNotes: Patient tolerated first treatment well. Pre-medicated with Ondansetron.

fractions.siteSpecificSideEffects: Occasional mild nausea, well-controlled. 2-3 loose stools/day.
fractions.patientConcerns: Concerned about diarrhea, given history of Crohn's.
fractions.instructionsGiven: Reinforced use of Loperamide and to follow a low-residue diet.
fractions.dailyNotes: OTV today. Patient managing side effects well. His underlying Crohn's may be contributing to GI symptoms, but they are currently well-controlled.

fractions.siteSpecificSideEffects: Diarrhea controlled with Loperamide. No significant nausea or skin reaction.
fractions.instructionsGiven: End-of-treatment instructions provided. Side effects will resolve over the next few weeks.
fractions.dailyNotes: Final treatment delivered. Patient tolerated the full course of adjuvant radiation well. Follow-up appointments scheduled.

imagingAndReports.summary: 4.5 cm mass in the jejunum, causing partial obstruction.

reportDetails.protocol: CT Abdomen/Pelvis with IV and Oral Contrast
reportDetails.findings: There is a 4.5 cm circumferential, apple-core-like mass in the proximal jejunum, causing high-grade partial small bowel obstruction with proximal dilation. No evidence of distant metastatic disease.
reportDetails.impression: Findings highly suggestive of a primary small bowel malignancy. Surgical consultation recommended.

imagingAndReports.summary: Adenocarcinoma of the Jejunum, Stage IIB (pT4, N0, M0).

reportDetails.diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma of the Jejunum, Moderately Differentiated
reportDetails.findings: Tumor measures 4.5 cm and perforates the visceral peritoneum (pT4). All surgical margins are negative. 0 of 12 examined lymph nodes are positive for malignancy (pN0). Lymphovascular invasion is identified.
reportDetails.comment: Pathologic Stage IIB. Given the T4 stage, adjuvant therapy is recommended.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Karen Brown (Surg Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient recovering well from segmental jejunectomy. Final pathology confirms T4N0 adenocarcinoma. Given the T4 stage, he is at high risk for locoregional recurrence. Will refer to Medical Oncology for discussion of adjuvant chemotherapy, to be followed by adjuvant radiation therapy.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient with resected Stage IIB small bowel adenocarcinoma. Discussed adjuvant therapy. Plan for 4 cycles of 5-FU/Leucovorin, to be followed by consolidative chemoradiation. Patient agrees to proceed.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Thomas Wilson (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient s/p jejunal resection and adjuvant chemo for T4N0 small bowel adenocarcinoma. He is now referred for adjuvant radiation to the tumor bed and regional nodes. Plan for 50 Gy in 25 fractions via IMRT. Discussed rationale and potential GI side effects. Patient understands and wishes to proceed.
